If the button has an icon and a visible label, you can omit the assistiveText.icon prop and use the label prop.

align.description: Aligns the right or left side of the menu with the respective side of the trigger. This is not intended for use with `nubbinPosition`.

className.description: Extra classnames to apply to the dropdown menu.

buttonClassName.description: CSS classes to be added to `li` element.

id.description: A unique ID is needed in order to support keyboard navigation, ARIA support, and connect the dropdown to the triggering button.

length.description: Provided to List to indicate number of items visible in the List. Pass `null` to display all items, or a string containing one of the numeric option values listed under [Dropdown Height](https://www.lightningdesignsystem.com/components/menus/#flavor-dropdown-height) at the right (eg. '5').

offset.description: Offset adds pixels to the absolutely positioned dropdown menu in the format: ([vertical]px [horizontal]px).

onSelect.description: Triggered when an item in the menu is clicked.

dropdown.name: dropdown

label.description: Wraps text in the proper markup and removes link styling to support use in the GlobalNavigationBar.

className.description: Class names to be added to the `span` element

id.description: Id string applied to first <span> inside of <li>

label.name: label

link.description: Wraps a link in the proper markup to support use in the GlobalNavigationBar.

active.description: Whether the item is active or not.

activeBackgroundColor.description: Allows alignment of active item with active application background color. If application background is dark, text color may need to be `#fff`. This can be done with the style prop.

assistiveText.description:
**Assistive text for accessibility.**
* `activeDescriptor`: The text that appears alongside a link that is currently active.

className.description: Class names to be added to the anchor element

href.description: The `href` attribute of the link. Please pass in bookmarkable URLs from your routing library. Use `GlobalNavigationBarButton` if a "real URL" is not desired. If the `onClick` callback is specified this URL will still be prevented from changing the browser's location.

id.description: The `id` attribute is applied to the `li` tag. _This was recently changed from being on the anchor tag._

label.description: Text to show for link item.

onClick.description: `function (event, href)` - fires when the link is clicked. If set, the browser location change to the `href` specified will be ignored, but the `href` will be included in an additional parameter passed to the callback.

onKeyDown.description: Triggered when a key is pressed down

onKeyPress.description: Triggered when a key is pressed and released

onKeyUp.description: Triggered when a key is released

onMouseEnter.description: Triggered when a mouse arrow hovers

onMouseLeave.description: Triggered when a mouse arrow no longer hovers

tabIndex.description: Write "-1" if you don't want the user to tab to the button.

link.name: link

region.description: Regions make up a GlobalNavigation Bar and typically contain links and dropdowns. The Primary region contains the AppSwitcher, Application Name, and Object Switcher. The secondary region typically has navigation betweens sections of the application. The tertiary region is aligned to the right side of the screen and contains shortcuts or actions.

children.description: Contents of region. Expects `GlobalNavigationBarLink`, `GlobalNavigationBarDropdown`, `GlobalNavigationBarApplicationName`, `AppSwitcher`, but could be any component. This is the place to pass in an Object Switcher until that is supported.

className.description: CSS classes to be added to the region

navigation.description: Wraps the `secondary` region in a `nav` and adds a role attribute

region.description:
Region wrap children in styling specific to that region. When `tertiary`
region is used, secondary region only supports four list items.

region.name: region

icon-settings.description:
The Icon Settings component allows for the path to the icons to be specified in all child components and is recommended to be used at the root of the application. It's render function is `return this.props.children`, so it can only have one child node.

**Individual sprites**
If you are using webpack it is advised to use the sprite properties
{actionSprite, standardSprite...} to specify the individual sprite paths so that webpack can
easily re-write the paths.
```
import actionSprite from '......';

<IconSettings actionSprite={actionSprite} ......>
```
**Root icon path**
Otherwise use the iconPath to specify the root path to where the icon files will be located in you application
such as `/assets/icons`.

iconPath.description:
Path to the root icon folder
example: `/assets/icons`

onRequestIconPath.description: Function to allow developers to return a custom icon path--for instance, on the same page with a local anchor (`#down`). This is helpful for when there are Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) issues with SVGs that are located on another domain such as a CDN. `({category, name}) => { return \`#${name}\` }`

actionSprite.description:
Path to the action sprite
example: '@salesforce-ux/design-system/assets/icons/action-sprite/svg/symbols.svg';

customSprite.description:
Path to the custom sprite
example: '@salesforce-ux/design-system/assets/icons/custom-sprite/svg/symbols.svg';

doctypeSprite.description:
Path to the doctype sprite
example: '@salesforce-ux/design-system/assets/icons/doctype-sprite/svg/symbols.svg';

standardSprite.description:
Path to the standard sprite
example: '@salesforce-ux/design-system/assets/icons/standard-sprite/svg/symbols.svg';

utilitySprite.description:
Path to the utility sprite
example: '@salesforce-ux/design-system/assets/icons/utility-sprite/svg/symbols.svg';

icon.description: The Icon component is the Lightning Design System Icon component and should be used for naked icons. For icons that are buttons, use the Button component component with variant='icon'.

assistiveText.description: **Assistive text for accessibility.** This object is merged with the default props object on every render. * `label`: Text that is visually hidden but read aloud by screenreaders to tell the user what the icon means. Naked icons must have assistive text, however, if you also have visible descriptive text with the icon, declare this prop as assistiveText=''.

className.description: CSS classes that are applied to the SVG.

containerClassName.description: CSS classes that are applied to the span.

containerStyle.description: Styles that are applied to the span.

icon.description: A custom SVG object to use instead of the supplied SLDS icons, look in `design-system-react/icons` for examples and syntax.

inverse.description: Setting `inverse` to true will switch the color of the icon: light to dark, dark to light.

name.description: Name of the icon. Visit Lightning Design System Icons to reference icon names.

path.description: Path to the icon. This will override any global icon settings

productTheme.description: Background theme color for the icon. **Only compatible with icon category `standard`**

style.description: Custom styles to be passed to the SVG. Could be used to change icon or background color.

title.description: Title attribute for the icon container

input.description: The HTML `input` with a label and error messaging.

aria-activedescendant.description: The aria-activedescendant attribute contains the ID of the currently active child object that is part of a composite widget within the Document Object Model. It makes do with the overhead of having all or more than one child focusable. As the name specifies, it helps in managing the current active child of the composite widget.

aria-autocomplete.description: Indicates if the suggestions in a composite widget are values that complete the current textbox input.

aria-controls.description:
An HTML ID that is shared with ARIA-supported devices with the
`aria-controls` attribute in order to relate the input with
another region of the page. An example would be a select box
that shows or hides a panel.

aria-describedby.description: The `aria-describedby` attribute is used to indicate the IDs of the elements that describe the object. It is used to establish a relationship between widgets or groups and text that described them. This is very similar to aria-labelledby: a label describes the essence of an object, while a description provides more information that the user might need.

aria-expanded.description: Use the `aria-expanded` state to indicate whether regions of the content are collapsible, and to expose whether a region is currently expanded or collapsed.

aria-haspopup.description: Indicates that the element has a popup context menu or sub-level menu.

aria-labelledby.description: The aria-labelledby attribute contains the element IDs of labels in objects such as input elements, widgets, and groups. The attribute establishes relationships between objects and their labels. Assistive technology, such as screen readers, use this attribute to catalog the objects in a document so that users can navigate between them. Without an element ID, the assistive technology cannot catalog the object.

aria-owns.description:
An HTML ID that is shared with ARIA-supported devices with the
`aria-controls` attribute in order to relate the input with
another region of the page. An example would be a search field
that shows search results.

aria-required.description: The `aria-required` attribute is used to indicate that user input is required on an element before a form can be submitted.

assistiveText.description:
**Assistive text for accessibility**
* `label`: Visually hidden label but read out loud by screen readers.
* `spinner`: Text for loading spinner icon.

autoComplete.description: Disabled brower's autocomplete when "off" is used.

children.description: Elements are added after the `input`.

className.description: Class names to be added to the outer container of the input.

defaultValue.description:
This is the initial value of an uncontrolled form element and
is present only to provide compatibility with hybrid framework
applications that are not entirely React. It should only be used
in an application without centralized state (Redux, Flux).
"Controlled components" with centralized state is highly recommended.
See [Code Overview](https://github.com/salesforce/design-system-react/blob/master/docs/codebase-overview.md#controlled-and-uncontrolled-components) for more information.

disabled.description: Disables the input and prevents editing the contents.

errorText.description: Message to display when the input is in an error state. When this is present, also visually highlights the component as in error.

fieldLevelHelpTooltip.description: A [Tooltip](https://react.lightningdesignsystem.com/components/tooltips/) component that is displayed next to the label.

fixedTextLeft.description: Displays text or node to the left of the input. This follows the fixed text input UX pattern.

fixedTextRight.description: Displays text or node to the right of the input. This follows the fixed text input UX pattern.

hasSpinner.description: If true, loading spinner appears inside input on right hand side.

iconLeft.description: Left aligned icon, must be instace of `design-system-react/components/icon/input-icon`

iconRight.description: Right aligned icon, must be instace of `design-system-react/components/icon/input-icon`

id.description: Every input must have a unique ID in order to support keyboard navigation and ARIA support.

inlineHelpText.description: Displays help text under the input.

inputRef.description: This callback exposes the input reference / DOM node to parent components. `<Parent inputRef={(inputComponent) => this.input = inputComponent} />

isStatic.description: Displays the value of the input statically. This follows the static input UX pattern.

label.description: This label appears above the input.

onChange.description: This callback fires when the input changes. Passes in `event, { value }`.

onClick.description: This event fires when the input is clicked.

onInput.description: Similar to `onchange`. Triggered when an element gets user input.

onInvalid.description: Triggered when a submittable `<input>` element is invalid.

onKeyDown.description: Triggered when a key is pressed down

onKeyPress.description: Triggered when a key is pressed and released

onKeyUp.description: Triggered when a key is released

onSelect.description: Triggered after some text has been selected in an element.

onSubmit.description: Fires when a form is submitted.

placeholder.description: Text that will appear in an empty input.

minLength.description: Sets the minimum number of characters that an `<input>` can accept.

minValue.description: Specifies minimum accepted value for a counter input

maxLength.description: Sets the maximum number of characters that an `<input>` can accept.

maxValue.description: Specifies maximum accepted value for a counter input

name.description: Name of the submitted form parameter.

readOnly.description: Displays the value of the input as read-only. This is used in the inline edit UX pattern.

required.description: Highlights the input as a required field (does not perform any validation).

step.description: Determines the step size upon increment or decrement. Can be set to decimal values.

styleInput.description: styles to be added to input

styleContainer.description: Custom styles to be passed to the component container

type.description: The `<Input>` element includes support for all HTML5 types.

value.description: The input is a controlled component, and will always display this value.

variant.description: Which UX pattern of input? The default is `base` while other option is `counter`

search.description: A `Search` is an `Input` which renders the search icon by default. It can be cleared, too. All `Input` props not specified as props already may be used with this component and will override defaults.

assistiveText.description:
**Assistive text for accessibility.**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `label`: Assistive text to search input

clearable.description: Adds a clear button to right side of the input

onClear.description: Triggers when the clear button is clicked

onSearch.description: This event fires when enter is pressed in the `input` or the search button is clicked.

search.name: search

location-map.description: A location map component is used to find and show locations

methods.name: getId
methods.docblock: Get the LocationMap's HTML id. Generate a new one if no ID present.
methods.description: Get the LocationMap's HTML id. Generate a new one if no ID present.

methods.name: handleClick
methods.docblock: Handles clicking of a location
methods.description: Handles clicking of a location

className.description: CSS class names to be added with `slds-map` class. `array`, `object`, or `string` are accepted.

classNameContainer.description: CSS class names to be added to the container element. `array`, `object`, or `string` are accepted.

defaultLocation.description:
Accepts location object that will be shown if no location has been selected. Required
 * `id` : A unique identifier string for the location
 * `name` : Name of the location
 * `address` : Address of the location

id.description: HTML id for component.

labels.description:
Labels
 * `title` - Title for the LocationMap component.

locations.description:
Array of locations objects for the LocationMap component.**
Each location object can contain:
 * `id` : A unique identifier string for the location
 * `name` : Name of the location
 * `address` : Address of the location

onClickLocation.description: Callback function triggered when a location is selected

googleAPIKey.description: Accepts a Google Map API Key that will be used for showing the map

selection.description:
Accepts location object that will be shown when selected
 * `id` : A unique identifier string for the location
 * `name` : Name of the location
 * `address` : Address of the location

media-object.description: When you need text and a figure next to each other, use a media object.

canTruncate.description: Often the body may need to be truncated for correct layout. This is only applicable if using the component within a flexbox container.

className.description: Class names to be added to the component's HTML tag with `slds-media` class.

body.description: The body is often text such as a heading or paragraph.

figure.description: The figure is the optional visualization of the text within the body.

verticalCenter.description: Vertically centers the body with the middle of the figure.

menu-dropdown.description:
The MenuDropdown component is a variant of the Lightning Design System Menu component. This component
may require a polyfill such as [classList](https://github.com/yola/classlist-polyfill) due to
[react-onclickoutside](https://github.com/Pomax/react-onclickoutside) if Internet Explorer 11
support is needed.

This component is wrapped in a [higher order component to listen for clicks outside itself](https://github.com/kentor/react-click-outside) and thus requires use of `ReactDOM`.

params.name:
{
	event,
	isOpen = true,
	keyCode,
	onFocus = this.handleKeyboardFocus,
	onSelect,
	target,
	toggleOpen = noop,
}

align.description: Aligns the menu center, right, or left respective to the trigger. This is not intended for use with `nubbinPosition`.

assistiveText.description: This prop is passed onto the triggering `Button`. Text that is visually hidden but read aloud by screenreaders to tell the user what the icon means. You can omit this prop if you are using the `label` prop.

buttonClassName.description: CSS classes to be added to triggering button.

buttonInverse.description: If true, button/icon is white. Meant for buttons or utility icons on dark backgrounds.

buttonVariant.description: This prop is passed onto the triggering `Button`. Determines variant of the Button component that triggers dropdown.

checkmark.description: If true, renders checkmark icon on the selected Menu Item.

children.description: If you need custom content _and_ a list, use a `<Popover>` instead.

className.description: CSS classes to be added to dropdown menu.

containerClassName.description: By default, these class names will be added to the absolutely-positioned `Dialog` component.

disabled.description: This prop is passed onto the triggering `Button`. Prevent dropdown menu from opening. Also applies disabled styling to trigger button.

hasStaticAlignment.description: Prevents the dropdown from changing position based on the viewport/window. If set to true your dropdowns can extend outside the viewport _and_ overflow outside of a scrolling parent. If this happens, you might want to consider making the dropdowns contents scrollable to fit the menu on the screen. `hasStaticAlignment` disables this behavior and allows this component to extend beyond boundary elements. _Not tested._

hint.description: This prop is passed onto the triggering `Button`. Associates an icon button with another element on the page by changes the color of the SVG. Please reference Lightning Design System Buttons > Hint.

hoverCloseDelay.description: Delay on menu closing in milliseconds.

iconCategory.description: Name of the icon category. Visit Lightning Design System Icons to reference icon categories.

iconName.description: Name of the icon. Visit Lightning Design System Icons to reference icon names.

iconPosition.description: If omitted, icon position is centered.

iconVariant.description: For icon variants, please reference Lightning Design System Icons.

iconSize.description: Determines the size of the icon.

id.description: A unique ID is needed in order to support keyboard navigation, ARIA support, and connect the dropdown to the triggering button.

inverse.description: Adds inverse class to the dropdown

isOpen.description: Forces the dropdown to be open or closed. See controlled/uncontrolled callback/prop pattern for more on suggested use view [Concepts and Best Practices](https://github.com/salesforce-ux/design-system-react/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#concepts-and-best-practices)

label.description: This prop is passed onto the triggering `Button`. Text within the trigger button.

listItemRenderer.description: Custom element that overrides the default Menu Item component.

length.description: This prop is passed into the List for the menu. Pass null to make it the size of the content, or a string with an integer from here: https://www.lightningdesignsystem.com/components/menus/#flavor-dropdown-height

menuPosition.description:
Please select one of the following:
* `absolute` - (default) The dialog will use `position: absolute` and style attributes to position itself. This allows inverted placement or flipping of the dialog.
* `overflowBoundaryElement` - The dialog will overflow scrolling parents. Use on elements that are aligned to the left or right of their target and don't care about the target being within a scrolling parent. Typically this is a popover or tooltip. Dropdown menus can usually open up and down if no room exists. In order to achieve this a portal element will be created and attached to `body`. This element will render into that detached render tree.
* `relative` - No styling or portals will be used. Menus will be positioned relative to their triggers. This is a great choice for HTML snapshot testing.

menuStyle.description: Style applied to menu element (that is the `.slds-dropdown` element)

nubbinPosition.description: Positions dropdown menu with a nubbin--that is the arrow notch. The placement options correspond to the placement of the nubbin. This is implemeted with CSS classes and is best used with a `Button` with "icon container" styling (`iconVariant="container"`). Use with `isInline` prop, since positioning is determined by CSS via absolute-relative positioning, and using an absolutely positioned menu will not position the menu correctly without manual offsets.

onBlur.description: Is only called when `openOn` is set to `hover` and when the triggering button loses focus.

onClick.description: This prop is passed onto the triggering `Button`. Triggered when the trigger button is clicked.

onFocus.description: Is only called when `openOn` is set to `hover` and when the triggering button gains focus.

openOn.description: Determines if mouse hover or click opens or closes the dropdown menu. The default of `click` opens the menu on click, touch, or keyboard navigation and is highly recommended to comply with accessibility standards. The other options are `hover` which opens when the mouse enters the focusable area, and `hybrid` which causes the menu to open on clicking of the trigger, but closes the menu when the mouse leaves the menu and trigger area. If you are planning on using `hover` or `hybrid`, please pause a moment and reconsider.

onMouseDown.description: Called when mouse clicks down on the trigger button.

onMouseEnter.description: Called when mouse hovers over the trigger button. This is only called if `this.props.openOn` is set to `hover`.

onMouseLeave.description: Called when mouse hover leaves the trigger button. This is only called if `this.props.openOn` is set to `hover`.

onSelect.description: Triggered when an item in the menu is clicked.

onOpen.description: Triggered when the dropdown is opened.

onClose.description: Triggered when the dropdown is closed.

style.description: An object of CSS styles that are applied to the triggering button.

tabIndex.description: Write "-1" if you don't want the user to tab to the button.

overlay.description: If `true`, adds a transparent overlay when the menu is open to handle outside clicks. Allows clicks on iframes to be captured, but also forces a double-click to interact with other elements. If a function is passed, custom overlay logic may be defined by the app.

tooltip.description: This prop is passed onto the triggering `Button`. It creates a tooltip with the content of the `node` provided.

tooltipMenuItem.description: Accepts a `Tooltip` component to be used as the template for menu item tooltips that appear via the `tooltipContent` options object attribute. Must be present for `tooltipContent` to work

triggerClassName.description: CSS classes to be added to wrapping trigger `div` around the button.

multiple.description: Whether this dropdown supports multi select.

width.description: To adjust the width of the menu dropdown

button-trigger.description: The Dropdown Button Trigger renders the default trigger button for the dropdown menu. If this component has children, it does not render itself to the DOM. Instead, it renders its child element, `Button`, and all that child's properties. This component may be used as a template to create custom triggers that do not use `Button`.

children.description:
Import the module `design-system-react/dropdown/button-trigger` and render a grandchild of the element type `Button`. Any `props` specified on that `Button` will be assigned to the triggering button. Any `id` prop or event hanlders (`onBlur`, `onClick`, etc.) set on the button grandchild will be overwritten by `MenuDropdown` to allow functionality and accessibility.
```
<Dropdown>
  <Trigger>
  <Button iconCategory="utility" iconName="settings" />
  </Trigger>
</Dropdown>
```

className.description: CSS classes to be added to triggering button.

id.description: A unique ID is needed in order to support keyboard navigation, ARIA support, and connect the dropdown to the triggering button. This is provided by the `MenuDropdown`. Please use `MenuDropdown` to set.

isOpen.description: Informs the trigger on the open/close state of the dropdown menu

menu.description: By Default the dropdown menu is inside a `Dialog` component.

onBlur.description: Is only called when `openOn` is set to `hover` and when the triggering button loses focus.

onClick.description: This prop is passed onto the triggering `Button`. Triggered when the trigger button is clicked.

onFocus.description: Is only called when `openOn` is set to `hover` and when the triggering button gains focus.

onMouseDown.description: Called when mouse clicks down on the trigger button.

onMouseEnter.description: Called when mouse hovers over the trigger button. This is only called if `this.props.openOn` is set to `hover`.

onMouseLeave.description: Called when mouse hover leaves the trigger button. This is only called if `this.props.openOn` is set to `hover`.

openOn.description: Determines if mouse hover or click opens the dropdown menu. The default of `click` is highly recommended to comply with accessibility standards. If you are planning on using hover, please pause a moment and reconsider.

triggerRef.description: The ref of the actual triggering button.

triggerClassName.description: CSS classes to be added to wrapping trigger `div` around the button.

button-trigger.name: button-trigger

modal.description: The Modal component is used for the Lightning Design System Modal and Notification > Prompt components. The Modal opens from a state change outside of the component itself (pass this state to the isOpen prop). For more details on the Prompt markup, please review the Notifications > Prompt. By default, `Modal` will add `aria-hidden=true` to the `body` tag, but this disables some assistive technologies. To prevent this you can add the following to your application with `#mount` being the root node of your application that you would like to hide from assistive technologies when the `Modal` is open. ``` import settings from 'design-system-react/components/settings'; settings.setAppElement('#mount'); ``` This component uses a portalMount (a disconnected React subtree mount) to create a modal as a child of `body`.

ariaHideApp.description: Boolean indicating if the appElement should be hidden.

assistiveText.description:
**Assistive text for accessibility.**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `dialogLabel`: This is a visually hidden label for the dialog. If not provided, `heading` is used.
* `dialogLabelledBy`: This describes which node labels the dialog. If not provided and dialogLabel is unavailable, `id` is used.
* `closeButton`: This is a visually hidden label for the close button.

children.description: Modal content.

className.description: Custom CSS classes for the modal `section` node classed `.slds-modal` and the parent of `.slds-modal__container`. Uses `classNames` [API](https://github.com/JedWatson/classnames).

containerClassName.description: Custom CSS classes for the modal's container. This is the child element of `.slds-modal` with class `.slds-modal__container`. Uses `classNames` [API](https://github.com/JedWatson/classnames).

contentClassName.description: Custom CSS classes for the modal's body. This is the element that has overflow rules and should be used to set a static height if desired. Use `classNames` [API](https://github.com/JedWatson/classnames).

contentStyle.description: Custom styles for the modal's body. This is the element that has overflow rules and should be used to set a static height if desired.

directional.description: If true, modal footer buttons render left and right. An example use case would be for "back" and "next" buttons.

disableClose.description: If true, Modals cannot be dismissed by clicking on the close icon or pressing esc key.

dismissOnClickOutside.description: If true, Modals can be dismissed by clicking outside of modal. If unspecified, defaults to disableClose.

onRequestClose.description: Callback to fire with Modal is dismissed

footer.description: Accepts a node or array of nodes that are typically a `Button` or `ProgressIndicator`. If an array, the nodes render on the right side first but are then floated left and right if directional prop is `true`.

header.description: Allows for a custom modal header that does not scroll with modal content. If this is defined, `heading` and `tagline` will be ignored. The close button will still be present.

headerClassName.description: Adds CSS classes to the container surrounding the modal header and the close button. Use `classNames` [API](https://github.com/JedWatson/classnames).

id.description: Unique identifier for the modal. The id is automatically generated if not provided

isOpen.description: Forces the modal to be open or closed.

parentSelector.description: Function whose return value is the mount node to insert the Modal element into. The default is `() => document.body`.

portalClassName.description: Custom CSS classes for the portal DOM node. This node is a direct descendant of the `body` and is the parent of `ReactModal__Overlay`. Use `classNames` [API](https://github.com/JedWatson/classnames).

prompt.description: Styles the modal as a prompt.

size.description: Specifies the modal's width. May be deprecated in favor of `width` in the future.

tagline.description: Content underneath the heading in the modal header.

title.description: Content underneath the title in the modal header.

heading.description: Text heading at the top of a modal.

toast.description: Allows adding additional notifications within the modal.

page-header.description: The PageHeader component adds PageHeader, PageHeader.Info, PageHeader.Title, PageHeader.DetailRow, and PageHeader.DetailBlock.

className.description: Optional class name

details.description: An array of detail blocks (used in "recordHome" variant)

label.description: The label property can be a string or a React element

icon.description: The page header icon. Expects an Icon component

info.description: The info property can be a string or a React element

joined.description: Makes PageHeader joinable with DataTable by adding appropriate classes/styling

nameSwitcherDropdown.description: Used with the `object-home` variant. Accepts a node, typically a Dropdown component

onRenderActions.description:
Actions content to appear on the upper right side of the page header.
Returned content must be either a SLDSPageHeaderControl component or an element/fragment with children that are all SLDSPageHeaderControl components.
Prop 'contentRight' will be deprecated soon, use 'onRenderActions' instead.

onRenderControls.description:
Controls content to appear on the lower right side of the page header.
Returned content must be either a SLDSPageHeaderControl component or an element/fragment with children that are all SLDSPageHeaderControl components.
Prop 'navRight' will be deprecated soon, use 'onRenderControls' instead.

title.description: The title property can be a string or a React element

trail.description: An array of react elements presumably anchor <a> elements.

variant.description:
The type of component
Note: Extra options are added to make the version backward compatible

control.description: The PageHeaderControl component is used to wrap individual controls within PageHeader 'actions' and 'controls' sections.

className.description: Optional class name

control.name: control

panel.description: A panel provides detailed contextual information or contextual filtering options. [Filter](/components/filters/) component should be used as children. Menus within a Filter Popover will need to not have "portal mounts" and be inline.

cancelLabel.description: Label for button that cancels modified filters

children.description:
Pass in `FilterList`'s of `Filters`:

```
<FilterGroup
  variant="panel"
>
  <FilterList>
  <Filter
    property="Show Me"
    predicate="All Wackamoles"
  >
  {popoverContents}
  </Filter>

</FilterGroup>
```

footer.description: Allows for customization of footer. This will be added after any `FilterList`'s in the DOM. If using Panel Filter Group outside of a panel, do not set the variant to `panel` and header and footer will be removed.

header.description: Allows for customization of header. This will be added before any `FilterList`'s in the DOM. If using Panel Filter Group outside of a panel, do not set the variant to `panel` and header and footer will be removed.

heading.description: The heading within the header of the filtering panel

modified.description: Shows confirmation heading. Please see `onRequestCancel` and `onRequestSave`.

onClickAdd.description: Callback triggered when "Add Filter" is clicked. Recieves an `event`.

onClickRemoveAll.description: Callback triggered when "Remove All" is clicked. Recieves an `event`.

onRequestCancel.description: When the panel's cancel button is clicked in order to reset filter panel to previous state.

onRequestClose.description: When the panel's close button is clicked. Please place Panel within another element to control position and visibility.

onRequestSave.description: When the panel's save button is clicked in order to confirm filter panel state.

removeAllLabel.description: Localized description of the "Remove All" button in the footer

saveLabel.description: Label for button that saves modified filters

variant.description: Adds in default Panel header and footer

lockedHeading.description: Heading for a group of filters that are locked

pill-container.description: A `PillContainer` is a container that holds one or more pills. Use it for a list of pills in a container that resembles an `input` form field. It is not intended for navigation.

assistiveText.description:
**Assistive text for accessibility**
* `listboxLabel`: This is a label for the listbox. The default is `Selected Options:`.
* `removePill`: Used to remove a selected item (pill). Focus is on the pill. This is not a button. The default is `Press delete or backspace to remove`.

className.description: CSS classes to be added to the pill container

id.description: HTML id for pill container

labels.description:
**Text labels for internationalization**
* `removePillTitle`: Title on `X` icon

options.description:
**Array of pill objects.**
Each object can contain:
* `avatar`: An `Avatar` component.
* `error`: Adds error styling
* `icon`: An `Icon` component.
* `id`: A unique identifier string.
* `label`: A primary string of text.
* `title`: Text that appears on mouse hover. Most helpful for long labels.
```
{
	id: '2',
	label: 'Salesforce.com, Inc.',
	title: 'Salesforce.com, Inc. - Want to work here?',
},
```
`options` with array length of zero will remove this component from the DOM.

onClickPill.description: Function called when a pill is clicked

onRequestRemovePill.description: Function called when a pill is requested to be 'removed' via the delete key or 'X' icon click.

style.description: Custom style object to be passed to the pill container

variant.description: Specifies the pill styling at the container level. `bare` removes border styling from all pills.

pill.description: A pill displays a label that can contain links and can be removed from view. Use `PillContainer` for a list of pills in a container that resembles an `input` form field. A pill is useful for displaying read-only text that can be added and removed on demand.

popover.description: The Popover component is a non-modal dialog. It should be paired with a clickable trigger such as a `Button`. It traps focus from the page and must be exited if focus needs to be outside the Popover. Use a `Tooltip` if there are no call to actions within the dialog. A `Tooltip` does not need to be clicked. Multiple popovers open at the same time, each with focus trap is not supported.

align.description: Aligns the popover with the respective side of the trigger. That is `top` will place the `Popover` above the trigger.

assistiveText.description:
**Assistive text for accessibility.**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `closeButton`: This is a visually hidden label for the close button.

ariaLabelledby.description: HTML `id` of heading for popover. Only use if your header is within your popover body.

children.description: Multiple children of any kind are allowed, but the first child must serve as the trigger component. Many props will be passed into this trigger related to popover interactions. The trigger needs to be a clickable element, such as a `Button` or an anchor tag (`a`).

body.description: The contents of the popover. This should also accept arrays.

classNameBody.description: CSS classes to be added to the popover footer. That is the element with `.slds-popover__body` on it.

classNameFooter.description: CSS classes to be added to the popover footer. That is the element with `.slds-popover__footer` on it.

disabled.description: This prop is passed onto the triggering `Button`. Prevent popover from opening. Also applies disabled styling to trigger button.

footer.description: A footer is an optional. Buttons are often placed here.

footerStyle.description: An object of CSS styles that are applied to the `slds-popover__footer` DOM element.

footerWalkthroughActions.description: Used with `walkthrough` variant to provide action buttons (ex: "Next" / "Skip" / etc) for a walkthrough popover footer. Accepts either a single node or array of nodes for multiple buttons.

hasNoCloseButton.description: Determines if the popover has a close button or not. Default is `false`

hasNoNubbin.description: Determines if the popover has a nubbin or not. Default is `false`

hasStaticAlignment.description: Prevents the Popover from changing position based on the viewport/window. If set to true your popover can extend outside the viewport _and_ overflow outside of a scrolling parent. If this happens, you might want to consider making the popover contents scrollable to fit the menu on the screen. When enabled, `position` `absolute` is used.

heading.description: All popovers require a heading that labels the popover for assistive technology users. This text will be placed within a heading HTML tag, or in an h2 within the popover body if used with `variant="walkthrough-action"`. A heading is **highly recommended for accessibility reasons.** Please see `ariaLabelledby` prop.

id.description: By default, a unique ID will be created at render to support keyboard navigation, ARIA roles, and connect the popover to the triggering button. This ID will be applied to the triggering element. `${id}-popover`, `${id}-dialog-heading`, `${id}-dialog-body` are also created.

isOpen.description: Forces the popover to be open or closed. See controlled/uncontrolled callback/prop pattern for more on suggested use [](https://github.com/salesforce-ux/design-system-react/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#concepts-and-best-practices) You will want this if Popover is to be a controlled component.

onClick.description: This function is passed onto the triggering `Button`. Triggered when the trigger button is clicked. You will want this if Popover is to be a controlled component.

onClose.description: This function is triggered when the dialog is closed. This occurs when the Dialog child component (that is the actual popover) is unmounted and removed from the DOM. This function returns `{event, { trigger, componentWillUnmount }`. Trigger can have the values `cancel`, `clickOutside`, or `newPopover`.

onKeyDown.description: Called when a key is pressed.

onMouseDown.description: Called when mouse clicks down on the trigger button.

onOpen.description: This function is triggered when the Dialog child component (that is the actual popover) is mounted and added to the DOM. The parameters are `event, { portal: }`. `portal` can be used as a React tree root node.

onRequestClose.description: This function is triggered when the user clicks outside the Popover or clicks the close button. You will want to define this if Popover is to be a controlled component. Most of the time you will want to set `isOpen` to `false` when this is triggered unless you need to validate something.

onRequestTargetElement.description: Callback that returns an element or React `ref` to align the Popover with. If the target element has not been rendered yet, the popover will use the triggering element as the attachment target instead. NOTE: `position="relative"` is not compatible with custom targets that are not the triggering element.

position.description:
Please select one of the following:
* `absolute` - (default) The dialog will use `position: absolute` and style attributes to position itself. This allows inverted placement or flipping of the dialog.
* `overflowBoundaryElement` - The dialog will overflow scrolling parents. Use on elements that are aligned to the left or right of their target and don't care about the target being within a scrolling parent. Typically this is a popover or tooltip. Dropdown menus can usually open up and down if no room exists. In order to achieve this a portal element will be created and attached to `body`. This element will render into that detached render tree.
* `relative` - No styling or portals will be used. Menus will be positioned relative to their triggers. This is a great choice for HTML snapshot testing. NOTE: this setting is not compatible with custom targets outside the trigger

stepText.description: Used with `walkthrough` variant to provide the step text (ex: "Step 1 of 4") for a walkthrough popover footer. If used with `variant="walkthrough-action"`, it will be placed in the popover body.

style.description: An object of CSS styles that are applied to the `slds-popover` DOM element.

overlay.description: If `true`, adds a transparent overlay when the menu is open to handle outside clicks. Allows clicks on iframes to be captured, but also forces a double-click to interact with other elements. If a function is passed, custom overlay logic may be defined by the app.

triggerClassName.description: CSS classes to be added to wrapping trigger `div` around the button.

variant.description: Determines the type of the popover. `error` and `warning` allows the  content body to scroll. Default is `base` _Tested with snaphots._

ID as a string

Enables Descriptive Progress Bar if label is provided

assistiveText.description:
**Assistive text for accessibility**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.

_Tested with snapshot testing._

id.description: HTML id for component.

className.description: CSS classes to be added to tag with `.slds-progress-bar`. Uses `classNames` [API](https://github.com/JedWatson/classnames).

labels.description: Label for the progress bar

orientation.description: Orientation of the progress bar to be used

progress-indicator.description: Progress Indicator is a component that communicates to the user the progress of a particular process.

methods.name: getId
methods.docblock: Get the progress indicator's HTML id. Generate a new one if no ID present.
methods.description: Get the progress indicator's HTML id. Generate a new one if no ID present.

assistiveText.description:
**Assistive text for accessibility**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `completedStep`: Label for a completed step. The default is `Completed Step`
* `disabledStep`: Label for disabled step. The default is `Disabled Step`
* `errorStep`: Label for a step with an error. The default is `Error Step`
* `percentage`: Label for Progress Bar. The default is `Progress: [this.props.value]%`. You will need to calculate the percentage yourself if changing this string.
* `step`: Label for a step. It will be typically followed by the number of the step such as "Step 1".

className.description: CSS class names to be added to the container element. `array`, `object`, or `string` are accepted.

completedSteps.description: Stores all completed steps. It is an array of step objects.

disabledSteps.description:
Stores all disabled steps. It is an array of step objects. Steps are still clickable/focusable,
this only disables cursor change and removes onClick and onFocus event callbacks.

errorSteps.description: Stores all error steps. It is an array of step objects and usually there is only one error step, the current step. If an error occurs a second error icon should be placed to the left of related confirmation buttons (e.g. Cancel, Save) and an Error Popover should appear indicating there are errors. These additional items are NOT part of this component. This note was included for visibility purposes. Please refer to [SLDS website](https://www.lightningdesignsystem.com/components/progress-indicator/) for full details **

id.description: HTML id for component.

orientation.description: Determines the orientation of the progress indicator

onStepClick.description:
Triggered when an individual step is clicked. By default, it receives an event and returns step state and the step object clicked: `{ isCompleted, isDisabled, isError, isSelected, step }`. Users are able to pass a callback handleClick function in forms of: <function name>(event, data) where data is the callback result.
```
const handleStepClick = function(event, data) { console.log(data); };
  <ProgressIndicator onStepClick={handleStepClick} />
```

onStepFocus.description:
Triggered when an individual step is focused. By default, it receives an event and returns step state and the step object clicked: `{ isCompleted, isDisabled, isError, isSelected, step }`. Users are able to pass a callback handleClick function in forms of: <function name>(event, data) where data is the callback result.
```
const handleStepFocus = function(event, data) { console.log(data); };
  <ProgressIndicator onStepFocus={handleStepFocus} />
```

selectedStep.description: Represents the currently selected or active step. It is a step object.

steps.description:
It is an array of step objects in the following form:
```
 [{
   id: <PropTypes.number> or <PropTypes.string>, has to be unique
   label: <PropTypes.string>, representing the tooltip content
   assistiveText: <PropTypes.string>, The default is `[Step props.index + 1]: [status]`. Status is if the step has been completed or in an error state.
 }],
 ```

tooltipIsOpenSteps.description: Stores all steps with opened tooltips. This property is mainly for development purposes. The tooltip should only show on hover for the user.

variant.description: Determines component style.

tooltipPosition.description:
Please select one of the following:
* `absolute` - (default if `variant` is `modal`) The dialog will use `position: absolute` and style attributes to position itself. This allows inverted placement or flipping of the dialog.
* `overflowBoundaryElement` - (default if `variant` is `base`) The dialog will overflow scrolling parents. Use on elements that are aligned to the left or right of their target and don't care about the target being within a scrolling parent. Typically this is a popover or tooltip. Dropdown menus can usually open up and down if no room exists. In order to achieve this a portal element will be created and attached to `body`. This element will render into that detached render tree.
* `relative` - No styling or portals will be used. Menus will be positioned relative to their triggers. This is a great choice for HTML snapshot testing.

progress-ring.description: Customizable and configurable progress ring. Will display progress in a circular progress bar factor, and is capable of displaying iconography inside of the ring structure.

theme.description: The theme applied to the ring.

icon.description: Overrides the icon to be displayed.

hasIcon.description: Display the icon associated with the theme.

flowDirection.description: Direction that the progress ring "flows." Default is counter-clockwise, or `drain`. For clockwise flow, use `fill`

size.description: Size of the progress ring. Default is 'medium'

A styled select list that can have a single entry checked at any one time.
The RadioGroup component wraps [Radio](/components/radios) components, which should be used as children.

labels.description:
**Text labels for internationalization**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `error`: Message to display when any of Checkboxes are in an error state.
* `label`: This label appears above the radio group.

onChange.description: This event fires when the radio selection changes.

required.description: Adds an indicator that this field is required.

name.description: The name of this radio group.

errorId.description: The ID of the error message, for linking to radio inputs with aria-describedby.

variant.description: Variants of radio groups such as Radio Button Group

radio.description:
A radio input that can have a single input checked at any one time. Radios should be wrapped with
a [RadioGroup](/components/radio-group) or [RadioButtonGroup](/components/radio-button-group)

assistiveText.description:
**Assistive text for accessibility**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `label`: This is used as a visually hidden label if, no `labels.label` is provided.

aria-describedby.description: The ID of an element that describes this radio input. Often used for error messages.

aria-labelledby.description: The aria-labelledby attribute establishes relationships between objects and their label(s), and its value should be one or more element IDs, which refer to elements that have the text needed for labeling. List multiple element IDs in a space delimited fashion.

checked.description: This is a controlled component. This radio is checked according to this value.

className.description: Class name to be passed to radio input wrapper ( `span` element)

defaultChecked.description:
This is the initial value of an uncontrolled form element and is present only to provide compatibility
with hybrid framework applications that are not entirely React. It should only be used in an application
without centralized state (Redux, Flux). "Controlled components" with centralized state is highly recommended.
See [Code Overview](https://github.com/salesforce/design-system-react/blob/master/docs/codebase-overview.md#controlled-and-uncontrolled-components) for more information.

id.description: A unique ID that is used to associating a label to the `input` element. This ID is added to the `input` element.

labels.description:
**Text labels for internationalization**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `heading`: Heading for the visual picker variant
* `label`: Label for the radio input

name.description: The name of the radio input group.

onChange.description: This event fires when the radio selection changes. Passes in `event, { checked }`.

value.description: The value of this radio input.

variant.description: Variant of the Radio button. Base is the default and button-group makes the radio button look like a normal button (should be a child of <RadioButtonGroup>).

coverable.description: Determines whether visual picker is coverable when selected (only for visual picker variant)

vertical.description: Determines whether the visual picker should be vertical or horizontal (only for visual picker variant)

onRenderVisualPicker.description: Allows icon to shown if radio is not selected (only for non-coverable visual picker variant)

onRenderVisualPickerSelected.description: Allows icon to shown if radio is not selected (only for visual picker variant)

onRenderVisualPickerNotSelected.description: Allows icon to shown if radio is not selected (only for visual picker variant)

description.description: Shows description for radio option (only for visual picker variant)

size.description: Allows icon to shown if radio is not selected (only for visual picker variant)

refs.description: Ref callback that will pass in the radio's `input` tag

scoped-notification.description: A Scoped Notification Component serve advisory information for the user that is not important enough to justify an alert.
